qas.question: What was the quality of sound recordings made with horns at the end of the acoustic era?
What were issues facing play back and recording mechanics?
Why do photos show take on horns?
How would a record recorded with a horn sound played through modern equipment?

answers.text: like it was recorded through a horn

qas.question: What was the cause of delicate and fine sound loss?

answers.text: took a lot of sound energy

context: Delicate sounds and fine overtones were mostly lost, because it <a4_0>took a lot of sound energy<a4_0/> to vibrate the recording horn diaphragm and cutting mechanism. There were <a1_0>acoustic limitations<a1_0/> due to mechanical resonances in both the recording and playback system. Some pictures of acoustic recording sessions show horns wrapped with tape to <a2_0>help mute these resonances<a2_0/>. Even an acoustic recording played back electrically on modern equipment sounds <a3_0>like it was recorded through a horn<a3_0/>, notwithstanding a reduction in distortion because of the modern playback. Toward the end of the acoustic era, there were <a0_0>many fine examples<a0_0/> of recordings made with horns.
